page.title: 20LONGTON BRICK CROFT
page.content: The Brick Croft used to be a wild area of overgrown gardens with a large variety of trees alongside flooded pits. Public paths went through and provided quiet walks. The wildlife was not unduly disturbed by the fishermen or exploring children. This year a{nature reserve}is being created with gravel paths and seating. The pits which have escaped infill have been smoothed and made safer since there will be housing nearby. * {* * *} * THIS INFORMATION WAS COMPILED BY Members of 2nd. Longton Scout Group. Fay McIlwaine Pauline McIlwaine Philip Marsh Clive Hawkins Cedric McIlwaine Yvonne McIlwaine Peter Dandy
